newsitem.title: USA: Universal sees '96 EPS at $0.10 to $0.12.
newsitem.headline: Universal sees '96 EPS at $0.10 to $0.12.

text.p: Universal Electronics Inc said on Tuesday it expected to post 1996 earnings per share of between $0.10 and $0.12.
The company said in a statement that net sales in the third quarter dropped to $25.6 million from $30.7 million for the same period a year earlier.
Third-quarter net income fell to $112,000, or $0.02 per share, from $1.38 million, or $0.20.
"We now expect earnings to be between $0.10 to $0.12 per share for fiscal 1996," said David Gabrielsen, the chairman, chief executive and president.
The company reported earnings of $0.05 a share last year.

"We are, however, continuing the turnaround at Universal Electronics by improving our cash flow and taking the actions necessary, particularly in our European retail and technology groups, for a strong earnings improvement in 1997."
